feature.name: Aconia
feature.origin: Fabia Aconia Paulina; Roman aristocratic woman, wife of Praetextatus (d. c. 384).

feature.name: Aelia
feature.origin: Aelia Oculata; Roman vestal virgin (c. 83).

feature.name: Africana
feature.origin: Cornelia Africana; Roman noblewoman, wife of Tiberus Gracchus Major, mother of Tiberus and Gaius Gracchus (c. 190-100 B.C.).

feature.name: Agonium Rupes
feature.origin: Roman festival celebrated several times a year; on this day the Rex sacrorum offered a ram in the Regia.

feature.name: Albalonga Catena
feature.origin: Alba Longa (usually identified with Castel Gandolfo), in the Alban Hills, 25 km SE of Rome. Ancient city founded by Ascanius.

feature.name: Albana
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Albia
feature.origin: Albia Dominica; Roman noblewoman, wife of Emperor Valens (c. 337–378).

feature.name: Alypia
feature.origin: Roman noblewoman, daughter of Anthemius and Aelia Euphemia, wife of Ricimer (fl. 467-472).

feature.name: Angioletta
feature.origin: Angioletta Coradini; Italian planetary scientist (1946-2011).

feature.name: Antonia
feature.origin: Famous Roman woman, daughter of M. Antonius and Octavia, wife of Drusus, mother of Germanicus, Livilla, and Emperor Claudius (36 B.C. - A.D. 37).

feature.name: Aquilia
feature.origin: Julia Aquilia Severa; Roman vestal virgin (c. 218).

feature.name: Aricia Tholus
feature.origin: City at the foot of Albanus Mons, once a powerful city in early Latium (present-day Ariccia).

feature.name: Arruntia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 70 B.C.).

feature.name: Bellicia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 3rd century).

feature.name: Brumalia Tholus
feature.origin: Roman festival of Bacchus celebrated on the day of the winter solstice.

feature.name: Bruttia
feature.origin: Bruttia Crispina; Roman Empress, wife of Emperor Commodus (164-191).

feature.name: Caesonia
feature.origin: Atia Balba Caesonia; Roman noblewoman, daughter of Julius Ceasar’s sister, mother of Emperor Augustus (85-43 B.C.).

feature.name: Calpurnia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 3rd century).

feature.name: Cannutia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 213).

feature.name: Canuleia
feature.origin: One of the first Roman vestal virgins.

feature.name: Caparronia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (d. 266 B.C.).

feature.name: Charito
feature.origin: Roman Empress, daughter of military commander Lucillianus, wife of Emperor Jovian (mid 4th century C.E.).

feature.name: Claudia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 143 B.C.).

feature.name: Coelia
feature.origin: Coelia Concordia; the last Roman vestal virgin and the last Vestalis Maxima (Chief Vestal) after the Temple of Vesta was closed in 391 (d. 406 A.D.).

feature.name: Cornelia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 23).

feature.name: Cossinia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Divalia Fossae
feature.origin: Roman festival held on December 21 in honor of the goddess Angerona.

feature.name: Domitia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 10-19).

feature.name: Domna
feature.origin: Julia; wife of Roman emperor Severus.

feature.name: Drusilla
feature.origin: Julia; famous Roman woman, second daughter of Germanicus and Agrippina, sister of Gaius (16-38).

feature.name: Eumachia
feature.origin: Priestess and prominent citizen of Pompeii (c. 1st century).

feature.name: Eusebia
feature.origin: Famous Roman woman, second wife of Constantius II.

feature.name: Eutropia
feature.origin: Wife of Maximian (c. 324).

feature.name: Fabia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (served as a vestal virgin from 73 to pre 58 B.C.).

feature.name: Fausta
feature.origin: Flavia Maxima; Roman Empress, wife of Constantine I, executed by him (d. 326).

feature.name: Feralia Planitia
feature.origin: Roman All Souls’ Day (February 21) where each household made offerings at the graves of its dead.

feature.name: Flavola
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 215).

feature.name: Floronia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (d. 216 B.C.).

feature.name: Fonteia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 69 B.C.).

feature.name: Fulvia
feature.origin: Wife of Clodius, Curio, and Antony.

feature.name: Fundania
feature.origin: Annia Fundania Faustina; Roman noblewoman, cousin of M. Aurelius, victim of Commodus (d. 192).

feature.name: Galeria
feature.origin: Galeria Fundana; wife of Emperor Vitellius, (c. 1st century).

feature.name: Gegania
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Graecina
feature.origin: Pomponia Graecina; Roman noblewoman, married to the consul Aulus Plautius (d. A.D. 83).

feature.name: Helena
feature.origin: Flavia Iulia Helena Augusta; mother of Constantine the Great.

feature.name: Herennia
feature.origin: Herennia Etruscilla; Roman Empress, wife of Emperor Decius, mother of Emperors Etruscus Herrenius and Hostilian (c. 250).

feature.name: Hortensia
feature.origin: Daughter of consul and advocate Quintus Hortensius (fl. c. 50 B.C.); she was known as a skilled orator.

feature.name: Iuinia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 107).

feature.name: Justina
feature.origin: Famous Roman woman, second wife of Emperor Valentinian.

feature.name: Laelia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 62).

feature.name: Laeta
feature.origin: Clodia; Roman vestal virgin (c. 213).

feature.name: Laurentia
feature.origin: Acca; mythical woman, wife of the shepherd Faustulus in Roman mythology, adoptive mother of Romulus and Remus.

feature.name: Lavinium Dorsum
feature.origin: Roman city revered it for its Aeneas traditions, its Venus temple, and it cults of Vesta (now Pratica de Mare).

feature.name: Lepida
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 25).

feature.name: Licinia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 140-113 B.C.).

feature.name: Lollia
feature.origin: Lollia Paulina; Roman woman of distinguished ancestry and great wealth, Roman Empress as the third wife of Caligula (15-49).

feature.name: Longina
feature.origin: Domitia; Roman empress, wife of Emperor Domitian, Augusta of Rome (c. 51-130).

feature.name: Lucaria Tholus
feature.origin: Ancient Roman feast held on July 19 when the Romans, defeated and pursued by the Gauls, retired and concealed themselves in the woods.

feature.name: Lucilla
feature.origin: Annia; Roman Empress, mother of M. Aurelius, married to Emperors L. Verus, and then to Ti. Claudius (c. 150-182).

feature.name: Lupercalia Fossa
feature.origin: Roman festival reflecting the needs of a small pastoral community, involving the sacrifice of goats and youths striking those whom they met with strips of goat skins, held February 15.

feature.name: Mamilia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 240).

feature.name: Marcia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (d. 113 B.C.).

feature.name: Mariamne
feature.origin: Second wife of Herod, king of Roman province Judea, known for her great beauty (c. 60-29 B.C.).

feature.name: Matronalia Rupes
feature.origin: Roman festival associated with the goddess Juno, celebrated on March 1.

feature.name: Metrodora
feature.origin: Claudia Metrodora; Greek woman with Roman citizenship, prominent public benefactor (mid 1st century A.D.).

feature.name: Minervina
feature.origin: The first wife of the Roman Emperor Constantine the Great, mother of Crispus (early 4th century).

feature.name: Minucia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 337 B.C.).

feature.name: Myia
feature.origin: Daughter of Pythagoras and Theano, wife of Milon of Crotona.

feature.name: Neptunalia Dorsa
feature.origin: Roman festival held on July 23 in the heat of the summer to honor Neptunus, god of water.

feature.name: Numisia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 204).

feature.name: Occia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (served as vestal virgin from c. 40 B.C. to A.D. 19).

feature.name: Octavia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (third century A.D.).

feature.name: Oppia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (d. 483 B.C.).

feature.name: Paculla
feature.origin: Paculla Annia; Campanian (Southern Italy) priestess of Bacchus whose reforms radically altered the Bacchanalian ritual in ancient Rome (fl. c. 188 B.C.).

feature.name: Parentatio Rupes
feature.origin: Roman festival that included performance of funeral rites, at the first day of the nine-day Parentalia festival honoring ancestors.

feature.name: Parilia Dorsa
feature.origin: Roman festival of the shepherds' and livestocks' god and goddess Pales, held on April 21, feast of purification of the beast, herdsmen, and stalls.

feature.name: Paulina
feature.origin: Aurelia; priestess for life of asylum-granting Artemis Pergaia, built hydreion at her own expense.

feature.name: Perpennia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 100-70 B.C.).

feature.name: Pinaria
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 600 B.C.).

feature.name: Placidia
feature.origin: Galla; daughter of the Roman Emperor Theodorius I, wife of Athualf, King of the Visigoths, and Constantius III, Roman Emperor (390-450).

feature.name: Plancia
feature.origin: Plancia Magna; daughter of Roman Senator Varus, wife of Tertullus, benefactress and patron of Perga, the capital of the Roman province of Pamphylia in Asia Minor (1st-2nd century A.D.).

feature.name: Pomponia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 213).

feature.name: Portia
feature.origin: Daughter of Roman statesman Cato Uticensis, second wife of M. Brutus (c. 70-43/42 B.C.).

feature.name: Postumia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 420 B.C.).

feature.name: Publicia
feature.origin: Flavia Publicia; Roman vestal virgin (c. 213).

feature.name: Rheasilvia
feature.origin: Rhea Silvia, Roman vestal virgin, mother of Romulus and Remus (c. 770 B.C.).

feature.name: Robigalia Catena
feature.origin: Roman festival where a dog was sacrificed to the god Robigus to prevent the red dust, or mildew, which attacked corn when the ear was beginning to form.

feature.name: Rubria
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 54).

feature.name: Rufillia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 250-301).

feature.name: Saturnalia Fossae
feature.origin: Three-day Roman festival starting on December 17, with sacrifices, public feasting, gifts, and slaves were waited on by their masters.

feature.name: Scantia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 23).

feature.name: Sentia
feature.origin: Amaesia Sentia; mentioned by Valerius Maximus as an instance of a female who pleaded her own cause before the praetor; called “Androgyne” for having a man’s spirit with a female body.

feature.name: Serena
feature.origin: Roman noblewoman, niece of Emperor Theodosius (c. 400).

feature.name: Severina
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 240).

feature.name: Sextilia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (d. 274 B.C.).

feature.name: Sossia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Tarpeia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Teia
feature.origin: Teia Euphrosyne Ruffina, Roman vestal virgin (c. 200).

feature.name: Torquata
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 48).

feature.name: Tuccia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Urbinia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin.

feature.name: Varronilla
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 10-83).

feature.name: Veneneia
feature.origin: One of the first Roman vestal virgins.

feature.name: Vestalia Terra
feature.origin: Roman festival of Vesta, held June 7-15.

feature.name: Vettenia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 200).

feature.name: Vibidia
feature.origin: Roman vestal virgin (c. 48).
